result.execSummary:
The defendant Ladell Demon Madlock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
TBD
**2/5/2016  ordered to Nicholas D.  in amount of $2,051.59.  Joint and several with coactor Tyree Williams 15CF2460.

COUNTS 1 AND 2: Pay DNA surcharges; all applicable fees of supervision. Court waived all other court costs due to the restitution to be imposed. Court ordered that supervision fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
CONCURRENT with Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the Probation Department.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
per order dated February 11, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1488-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Leon W. Todd is relieved of his obligation to further represent Ladell Madlock in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  20 YEARS with 114 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE  to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 2:   The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.  
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following:
Restitution to be determined.
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
Court waived all other court costs due to the restitution to be imposed.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
The Court ordered that supervison fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armour
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Letters from victims

Case adjourned for status on restitution in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.  Defendant is REMANDED.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE & ACKNOWLEDGMENT provided to defendant.

Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Continued Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Slomczewski-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  

The Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Ladell Demon Madlock in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  The Court amends Count 3 of the criminal complaint to Count 2.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

***Defendant ordered KEEP SEPERATE FROM  Co-actor Tyree Williams DOB 1-13-1994 when in custody***  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
